Question
========
Which of the following expressions allow you go from matrix $a$  to matrix $b$ with only one line of code?

$$a = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 \\
3 & 4 \\
5 & 6 \\
\end{bmatrix}$$


$$b = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 \\
3 & 5 \\
4 & 6 \\
\end{bmatrix}$$


Answerlist
----------
* `a[c(2,3),c(1,2)] <- c(3,4,5,6)`
* `a[c(2,3),c(1,2)] <- 3:6`
* `a[c(2,3),] <- c(3,4,5,6)`
* `a[c(2,3),c(1,2)] <- matrix(3:6,2,2)`
* `a[c(3,5)] <- c(4,5)`
* `a[c(2,3),c(1,2)] <- c(4,5)`
* `a[c(2,3),c(1,2)] <- 4:5`
* `a[2,3] <- c(4,5)`
* `a[c(2,3),c(1,2)] <- matrix(3:6,2,2,byrow=TRUE)`
* `a[c(3,5),] <- c(4,5)`


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Correct.
* Correct.
* Correct.
* Correct.
* Correct.
* Wrong. This command will return $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 & 4 \\ 5 & 5 \\ \end{bmatrix}$$
* Wrong. This command will return $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 & 4 \\ 5 & 5 \\ \end{bmatrix}$$
* Wrong. This command will return an error
* Wrong. This command will return $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 \\ \end{bmatrix}$$
* Wrong. This command will return an error
